turns.content: If i have only 3 full days for a trip in portugal, do you recommend lisbon or porto

Both Lisbon and Porto are great destinations in Portugal, and both have their own unique charm and attractions. However, if you only have three full days for your trip, I would recommend visiting Lisbon. Here's why:

1. Lisbon is the capital city of Portugal and has a wider range of things to see and do. It has many historical sites, museums, and cultural attractions, such as the Belem Tower, the Jeronimos Monastery, and the National Museum of Ancient Art.
2. Lisbon has a vibrant nightlife, with many bars, restaurants, and clubs, especially in the Bairro Alto neighborhood.
3. Lisbon is also located near several day-trip destinations, such as Sintra, Cascais, and the beaches of the Costa da Caparica.
4. Porto is a beautiful city and has a lot to offer, but it is smaller than Lisbon and can be explored in less time.

Overall, if you only have three days for your trip to Portugal, Lisbon offers more activities and attractions to fill your time.
can you build an iternerary for lisbon? in early april

Sure, here's a sample itinerary for 3 full days in Lisbon in early April:

Day 1:

* Morning: Start your day at the historic Alfama neighborhood and visit the Lisbon Cathedral and the Castle of São Jorge. Take a tram ride through the narrow streets of Alfama and enjoy the views of the city from the top of the hill.
* Afternoon: Walk to Baixa and visit the Praça do Comércio and the Rossio Square. Explore the streets of Chiado and visit the famous café A Brasileira for a coffee and a pastel de nata (traditional Portuguese custard tart).

Day 2:

* Morning: Take a day trip to Sintra and visit the Pena Palace and the Moorish Castle. Enjoy the beautiful gardens and the stunning views from the top of the hills.
* Afternoon: Return to Lisbon and visit the Belém neighborhood. See the Jerónimos Monastery and the Monument to the Discoveries, and don't forget to taste the famous Pastéis de Belém, a traditional Portuguese pastry.

Day 3:

* Morning: Take a walk along the Tagus River and visit the MAAT - Museum of Art, Architecture and Technology. Enjoy the views of the river and the modern architecture of the museum.
* Afternoon: Take a tram to the Bairro Alto neighborhood and enjoy the views of the city from the Miradouro de São Pedro de Alcântara. Explore the narrow streets of Bairro Alto and have dinner in one of the many traditional restaurants.

This itinerary is just a suggestion, and you can adjust it based on your interests and preferences. There are many other attractions and activities to explore in Lisbon, such as the National Museum of Ancient Art, the Calouste Gulbenkian Museum, and the LX Factory, a trendy art and culture district.
